On Escalation Ticket # 00438405 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Account ACV has been changed to 2407973.28.

On Escalation Ticket # 00438405 the new comment has been added: Csenge Antal:

Hello, 

I tried reproducing this issue with the 623.3001 windows client on 720+1334.

The only time I managed to generate logs from the future was when I changed the Windows time on my computer to 2055.
According to the attachments from this ticket, this issue occurred only on one day on each of those 3 computers, so I don't think this is the issue, but might worth asking the customer.

I also tried the following:

	 - 	Changed the Region, the language to Germany on the computer; 
	 - 	Tried with a different time zone on the server;
	 - 	I tried generating logs while being offline, set all devices to Allow / Deny

however, the issue did not reproduce on the QA side.


Please let me know if I can help with any more information.

[DevOps CommentId:11847915]

On Escalation Ticket # 00438405 the new comment has been added: Hello @Cecilia,

the customer has checked on his side and the problem still exists. The number of events go down, but some clients still generate events in the future.

e. g. LSJP240283, LPTP2051013

Please see the attached screenshot "Logs from the future as of 7 April 2025".

On Escalation Ticket # 00438405 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Account ACV has been changed to 1695173.28.

On Escalation Ticket # 00438405 the new comment has been added: The customer replied:

The client LSJP240283 is currently offline.

Registry-settings for LPTP2051013
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlTimeZoneInformation
Bias REG_DWORD 0xffffffc4
DaylightBias REG_DWORD 0xffffffc4
DaylightName REG_SZ @tzres.dll,-321
DaylightStart REG_BINARY 00000300050002000000000000000000
StandardBias REG_DWORD 0x0
StandardName REG_SZ @tzres.dll,-322
StandardStart REG_BINARY 00000A00050003000000000000000000
TimeZoneKeyName REG_SZ W. Europe Standard Time
DynamicDaylightTimeDisabled REG_DWORD 0x0
ActiveTimeBias REG_DWORD 0xffffff88

Please let me know, via which setting/registry Endpoint Protector detects the date.
The only setting on the Windows client that I found that could result in a date in the future was changing the region format to “Thai”. Then 2568 is shown in the calendar.
